text: The Cambridge Companion to Augustine refers to two volumes of essays about Augustine of Hippo and Augustinianism published in 2001 and 2014 by Cambridge University Press, with largely disjoint contents. The editors of the first version were Eleonore Stump and Norman Kretzmann, and for the second version Stump and David Vincent Meconi. ==References== ==Further reading== * * Category:2001 non-fiction books Category:2014 non-fiction books Category:Augustine studies Category:Cambridge University Press books
title: The Cambridge Companion to Augustine
